html.p: Given an [mathjaxinline]n\times n[/mathjaxinline] real matrix [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline], the following four conditions are all equivalent.

li.p: The columns of [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] form an orthonormal basis of [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^ n[/mathjaxinline].
[mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] preserves inner products; i.e., [mathjaxinline]\langle Av,Aw\rangle = \langle v,w\rangle[/mathjaxinline] for all [mathjaxinline]v,w\in \mathbb R^ n[/mathjaxinline].
[mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] preserves norms; i.e., [mathjaxinline]\| Av\| = \| v\|[/mathjaxinline] for all [mathjaxinline]v\in \mathbb R^ n[/mathjaxinline].

html.p: If any/all of them are true, we say that [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] is an orthogonal matrix.
